security: The dispatch details methods for recruiting, training, and debriefing individuals returning to Cuba, potentially compromising ongoing or future intelligence operations if this information were revealed.
summary: This dispatch from the Chief of Station, JMWAVE, details operational debriefings of individuals processed through the CAC in May 1962, assessing their potential for intelligence gathering and operational activities related to Cuba.
summary_one_paragraph: The dispatch, dated June 25, 1962, from the Chief of Station at JMWAVE to the Chief of Task Force V, outlines the debriefing results of several individuals who passed through the CAC (presumably a processing center) in May 1962. These individuals, including a former medical products salesman, a rural census taker, ex-railroad worker, a night club owner, and others, provided varying degrees of operational leads and intelligence. The document summarizes their potential for recruitment, exploitation, and dissemination of information related to Cuba, with specific mention of plans to assassinate Fidel Castro and the establishment of communication links.
title: Operational/GYROSE Operational Debriefings
